text: In this video, we will show you
how to clear your browser and app cache
on your Android device.
Note that some steps may differ slightly
depending upon your specific device model.
We will be using an LG V40 ThinQ phone.

Your web browser and apps
store bits of information
to help speed up your browsing experience.

However, over time,
performance can be impacted
as you collect a lot of these files.

In that case, clearing
your cache could help.
Open the Chrome app
and tap the three-dot icon
to open the drop-down menu.
Then tap on "History."
Then tap "Clear browsing data."
Using the time range drop-down menu
will allow you to choose from how far back
you want the cache to be cleared.
You can then choose what type of data
you would like to clear,

including your browsing
history, cookies, site data,
and cached images and files.
Underneath each category,

Google explains what clearing
each type of data does.
Once you have made your selections,

tap the "Clear data"
button to clear the cache.
Go to the settings menu on your device.
Tap "Storage."
Tap "Free up space."
Then tap "Temporary files & raw files."

Choose one or more of
the following options:

"Cached data," "Clip
Tray temporary files,"
and/or "Raw files from Camera."
And then tap "Delete."
